column1: good shape in, length quite full on the stumps, driven to cover
first runs of the day. Swinging back into the pads, tucked to fine leg
shortens his length a touch but there's nip away off the seam, left alone. Good start from Shardul
length, in and around the off stump, left alone once again
shapes away from the fifth stump, watched through to the keeper
doesn't bite the bait! Pitched up, inviting to drive but Hope happy to leave
on the money straightaway. Length on middle, defended off the backfoot
punches this short of length ball on middle to mid-on
much fuller on middle, hint of away movement, defended solidly
dug in short, zips past the helmet as Lewis manages to avoid that
follows it up with a full delivery across, left alone
punched to mid-on, no runs again. Watchful from the West Indies
full on the stumps, Hope covers the line and defends back
driven firmly but can't pierce the gap as Rahul moves swiftly to his left at mid-off
punched into the gap between cover and point. Lovely shape, but even-better technique as he planted forward and eased that away
goes wide of the crease and bowls full outside off, left alone
gorgeous drive but straight to mid-off
works this length ball from outside off to square leg
hustled! Short ball that jags back in to catch him on the hop, awkwardly fended into the leg side
uppish but safe! Looks to flay this over point but slices it on the bounce to Shardul at third man
delightful wrist work to pick the big gap between square leg and mid-on
top shot! Not a half-volley by any means but he plants forward and presents the full face to essay a classic off-drive past the bowler and mid-off
follows it up with a short ball to hustle him for pace, Hope looking to pull but gets into an awkward tangle and eventually bails out
stunning pull! Rolled his wrists nicely to hit this all along the ground to the square leg fence
slants a full ball across, pushed to mid-off
squared up by the late movement, squirted to point
searching for swing but gets away with that! Should've been wide but not given. Slanted full and across, Lewis leaves in anticipation of a wide call
whips it away off his hip to long leg, Shami comes around to cut that off
gets a thickish outside edge as he pushes forward at this length ball, rolls to backward point
tucks this short of length ball to midwicket
driven firmly to extra cover
driven wide of mid-off for a quick single
thick inside edge onto the pads! Shami's pronounced seam and late movement traps Hope on the crease as he pushes away from the body. Looking to drive on the up, but saved this time.
shortens his length a touch, pushed to cover point
dug in short, Hope sees that and ducks under it immediately
flicked uppishly into the gap. Jadhav had a lot of ground to cover from deep square. Again, superb wrist work
drilled back! Goes full, turns into a half-volley and Lewis says 'thank you very much'
better, much better! Shortens his length and slants it across, left alone
slower and fuller outside off, left alone
cracking drive, no one moved! Right in the slot and Lewis hammered it past the infield, cover and point were looking at each other.
closer to the stumps, on a length, turned to the leg side. Bowled at 148kph
dug in short, Lewis ducks under this
slips this length delivery down leg, some exercise for Shaun George
looks to pull but beaten by one that keeps low. Tried to fetch it from outside off
pulled into the vacant square leg region, Jadhav the boundary rider cuts it off
knuckleball on middle! Hint of deviation off the pitch as he landed it full, Lewis bunts it to mid-off for a quick single
there's cover, there's cover point but he still manages to bisect the two by hitting through the line. As beautiful as it can get
banged in short, Hope ready to pull but can't time this, seemingly because he's beaten for pace, rolls past square leg
dug in short again, tries to pull but bails out immediately. Touch and go that
short of length outside off, pushed to cover point. This one was at 145kph
turns this length delivery from offstump to midwicket
mistimes a drive to mid-off. There was width on offer to put that away, tried to hit it too hard and lost shape
dabs it into the off side and they scamper a single. Saini late to move on his followthrough
hits him on the pad but this pitched way outside leg. Lewis was looking to work this square

Jadeja has put down a tough, tough chance at point. This was smacked on the up by Lewis, the ball was travelling and by Jadeja's standards, it was very much in the realms of possibility. He was moving to his natural side as well. That he was a couple of yards inside the 30-yard circle made his reaction time that much shorter
runs this down to third man
defended solidly to cover
defended back with soft hands
dug in short, Lewis gets out of the way without much fuss
targets the short ball from over the wicket, trust me this was quite high. Not sure why it hasn't been called wide again
shows the full face of the bat to hammer it past the bowler and umpire. No chance for either of mid-on or mid-off. Sublime stuff
driven back to the bowler on his followthrough
wrists this to mid-on but takes the single comfortably even though he was deep inside the crease at the point of contact
ducks under this short ball that zips through to Pant
beaten as he looks to slap this through point off the backfoot
punched to mid-on, said no to a single straightaway
short of length, angling away, Lewis lets it go
gets well forward and defends
wrong'un on middle, reads it off the hand and pitch as he defends
steps out and eases this with the spin to long-off
thumps this to long-off as they jog the single
steps out and works this down to long-on
eases this to the left of point for a single, sensible
short of length on middle, defended into the leg side
too early into the pull, hit on the box. Ouch
dug in short on leg stump, ducks under it. Gavaskar on air calls it a dot-ball short-ball
squared up by the short of length delivery, defended off the outer part of the bat
tucks it off his hip to deep square. Touching close to 140kph on that occasion. Fifty up
stands tall and punches to Jadhav at deep point
drilled back past Kuldeep. Long-off had no chance, bullet drive that. Got as close as he could to the pitch of the delivery
wrong'un, lunges forward and blocks
a misfield off his own bowling gives Hope a single
nearly had him with a googly! Shapes to cut, then sees this wickedly spin back in, somehow manages to get behind the line.
goes right back into the crease as he defends
another wrong'un, there some dip on this but Lewis defends confidently
shortish on middle, tucked wide of midwicket.
punched to cover
defended back to Jadeja
driven straight to cover, hint of drift away for Jadeja
pushed to cover, looks for a single but is sent back

right into his swinging arc, Lewis can't hold back and he's holed out to Saini at long-on! Would've probably been six at Chinnaswamy but the boundaries at Barabati slightly bigger. Also, Jadeja slowed it down nicely, hit a good length to ensure Lewis didn't get underneath the delivery. The bat face turned in his hand as he swung through, so didn't get the power he would've liked. Good catch under pressure.
full and just outside off, driven to extra cover, against the turn

length outside off, looks to drive and is that dropped? The reaction suggests Pant might have spilled a chance there. He was cover driving from inside the line. It's also ricocheted off his body onto the stumps so they're checking for a stumping. Chase is well in. Replays confirm there was an edge on that
length and spinning in from just outside off, defended on the front foot
length and ripping in from outside off. Hurriedly jabbed into the covers
length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
nice flowing drive. Overpitched just outside off, plants the front leg out to get to the pitch and neatly drives it past cover
length on middle stump, punched down to long-on from deep in the crease
length on middle, leans in and jabs to long-on with the angle
length on middle, slight turn away from middle. Driven to extra cover
length at off, pushed to point off the front foot
length at the stumps, punched with the angle to long-on
length at off, leans in at drives to mid-off
length on middle stump, watchfully defended to midwicket off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-on
length outside off, leans in and drives against the turn to long-off
short of a length and turning in at off. Backs away and cuts but Thakur stops at cover point
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length and slight turn away from off stump. Defended into the covers
length on middle, deep in the crease and punched to long-on
full on leg, flicked to midwicket
length on middle, defended into the leg side
short of a length and turning away from off stump, can't get the back foot punch past Jadeja
short and just outside off, whipped to long-on off the back foot
length and just outside off, punched on the rise to extra cover

through him! Pitched at a good length and just outside off, right on the seam. Slams into the turf and cuts into Hope, who has put in a half stride across the stumps to try and work this into the leg side. He has completely missed it and he is livid with himself, out playing across the line
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended pitch side on the off side
overpitched at middle stump and drills it firmly down the pitch. Into the stumps at the other end, unfortunately
length and squaring him up as it turns away from off. Defended on the back foot
length at the stumps, defended from the crease
full on middle, flicked to long-on
length on middle, leans in and flicks to deep square's left
short of a length on middle, punched down the pitch off the back foot
full on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left
full and wide outside off, expansive drive to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, slapped on the rise to sweeper cover
full and just outside off, toe-ended drive back to the bowler
straight up into the body. Short and rising in from just outside off. Chase wants to evade that. Drops his bat as he leaps up to follow the bounce, but he can't get his right bicep out of the way
short in the corridor, defended into the leg side off his toes
short and just outside off, pulls into the floor neatly, to deep square's left
length and just outside off, punched to extra cover
length on leg stump, tickled into the square leg region with the turn
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length outside off, thick outside edge to backward point as he looks to drive on the front foot
through midwicket. Short of a length at the stumps. Punched firmly off the back foot and to KL Rahul's right. he dives but can't get a hand on that. Good balance on that
length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full googly on middle stump, gets it off the thick outside edge to extra cover as he looks to drive down the ground
length and turning into the stumps, defended off the back foot
googly at a length on off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length and turning away from off stump, punched straight to extra cover off the back foot
googly, short of a length and into the corridor. Cut to backward point
short of a length on off stump, backs away and punches straight to mid-off
length and down leg side. Looks to flick that and it's off the inside edge and past the keeper. Deep backward square cleans up to his left
dropped. Short and turning into leg stump. Exposes the stumps and looks to pull, gets an inside edge and Pant can't hold on jumping down leg side
length on middle, pushed to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
short of a length at middle stump, toe-ended aerial pull to deep midwicket
short and turning away outside off. Cut to sweeper cover
full toss floated up at middle stump, slugged along he turf and straight to deep square
googly at middle stump, gets the slog sweep off the inside part of the bat
length at middle, punched to long-off
short and just outside off. Cut straight to backward point
smoked over deep midwicket! That is hit hard. Whew. Full ball just outside off. Gets the front leg into the leg side and nails the connection on this
length on off stump, driven to long-off
brutal! Full and just outside off, reaches out at it and hits it over the bowler off the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length on off stump, pushed into the off side
driven upppishly but well wide of extra cover and beats long-off to the left. Length ball outside off and he went inside-out
length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square

valiant effort by KL Rahul but he can't quite keep this in. Short ball at middle stump, pulled aerially and off the high part of the bat. At deep midwicket, Rahul lunge high to his left and catches this one-handed. He then tries to flick it back into the ground but he can't manage that, ends up parrying it to his left. Might have also landed outside play with the ball still in his hand
short of a length on off, chopped to third man
length on leg, clipped to deep midwicket
top edge over the keeper. Short ball at leg stump, once again he can't connect cleanly on the pull
short outside off, gets on top of the bounce and steers that to third man
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
full and just outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
length on off, pushed to sweeper cover with the turn
googly, full on off stump. Driven with the turn to long-off
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover's left where Kohli stops low
short of a length and dying on the batsman as it turns away. Looks for the punch through cover but has ended up far too distant from the ball to connect

Hetmyer might have been run out there. Yes. Short of a length and just outside off. Dropped with soft hands to point's left. At point is Jadeja. Gets to that and can't hit the stumps at the strikers end

steered straight to fine leg! For the third straight attempt, Hetmyer can't control a pull. This is short at his hips. He's cramped and getting in an awkward position for the pull. The ball doesn't rise as much as anticipated and he ends up half-swiveling and just lifting this with the pace. Not too far, in the end. Saini has his first ODI wicket
length and just outside off. Opens the face and steers this to third man
short at middle stump, gets the front leg in the air and whips to deep square
length in the corridor, opens the face and runs this into the off side
short outside off. Jumps to get on top of that and closes the face to get this pull along the turf and between deep square and fine leg
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
length at the stumps, defended from the crease
length on middle, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, dropped into the off side off the back foot
length on off stump, pushed to long-off from the crease
nicely done. Length ball, flat and at off stump. He gets down on one knee and uses the pace to ramp this fine
short and pushed across the corridor. Leaps to cut and is beaten
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
tonks off stump! A delicious yorker, this one. Just under 140kph and landing on the crease. Chase is too late getting the bat down on this
yorker-length that tails into the pads to hit Pollard, but this was sliding down. Superb ball first up
short ball just outside off, Pollard manages to evade that
this is a rip roaring bouncer at serious pace, Pollard sways out and Pant leaps high to put out a one-handed half-stop
nips back in off a length, Pollard defends gently to the leg side
turns this gently back to the bowler
flatter and round-armish on middle, defended to midwicket
reverse-swept to the cover boundary. Quite bizarre. Hit it in front of square, Rahul didn't pick it up but he wouldn't have had a chance
makes room and cuts to short third man
punched back, superb stop moving swiftly to his left
flatter on middle, worked to midwicket as Jadeja hares across to stop
steams in, bowls full and across, driven to sweeper cover

strikes him on the toe! Absolute toe-crusher that forces Saini to go up. Big appeal, no bat but impact was just outside off. They've taken a review. Let's see Original decision: not out. It will remain that way. Exceptional delivery but a poor call to review. Pant was in a great position to see that and should've been more assertive. India lose a review
hops back and defends this short of length delivery
plays the half-pull up and over to deep square leg
yorker-length delivery tailing in, squirted to midwicket
banged in short, Pollard takes a step outside the crease and lets it go
tucks this behind square on the leg side as they jog through for a single
pushed into the covers, slight hesitation but they get through for a single
splits the gap between cover point and shot third man. Short, he made room and then cracked that off the backfoot. Superb
worked with the spin to wide long-on
jabs it away into the off side as they scamper a quick single
makes room and punches to point. That's the end of Jadeja's spell
big appeal but sliding down leg. Got this to angle in a long way with Pollard looking to work it wide of midwicket
leading edge, on the bounce to mid-off. An overthrow at the bowler's end means the pressure is released
driven firmly along the ground to deep cover
dug in short, rising but there's no trouble for Pollard as he tucks it to long leg
cramped for room  but looks to pull nonetheless, can't pierce the gap as he hits this to Rohit at midwicket
width and he's flayed that away to square third man
rocks back and cuts to deep point
just about manages to clear the ropes! Googly on a length, Pollard uses his long reach to good effect as he muscles this down the ground. Easy
edged as he lunges forward to jab, rolls to point
slow turn on this wrong'un, keeps a touch low, rolls off an inside edge to midwicket
right into his swinging arc and Pollard clobbers this over deep cover. Superb hit, saw it tossed up and didn't hold back. Ferocious
slapped straight to Jadeja at extra cover
punched to mid-off
pushes this to point, wants a single but Jadeja is a tad too quick for his liking
punched firmly to cover
firmly driven to sweeper cover
banged in short, Pollard bails out of a pull
back of a length on off, pushed between cover and point for a quick single
good length outside off, defended into the covers
full and straight, hint of tail in, Pollard squirts it off an inside edge to mid-on. Kuldeep a tad late to react
gorgeous! A touch too full and Pooran plays a picture-perfect extra cover drive to beat the diving Kuldeep at wide mid-off. Held the pose for the cameras, he enjoyed that shot
punched to mid-off, takes on Kuldeep and they scamper a single again
hustled for pace, this one deflects to short fine off the thigh pad
driven between cover and point, down to the boundary rider
disdainful! Steps out and wallops a length ball into the stands over long-off
shortens his length, bunts this to point
punched on the up, Jadhav does the mopping up at sweeper cover
works this with the angle to long-on
inside edge onto the pads as he gets outside the line to defend
bails out of this short of length ball outside off. Could've looked to upper cut if he really wanted
drifting into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
googly that he pitches outside leg, Pollard picks it off the hand and defends as it turns sharply
punched to point, this one stopped on him
makes room and punches to Kohli at cover
shapes to cut, the extra bounce means he can only get a thick edge and this races past short third
flat-bats this down to long-on to keep strike
length ball on middle, defended back
takes him on with the pull, one bounce to Rahul at deep backward square leg
flicks this full toss off his pads to the deep square leg fence. Poor ball, yorker gone wrong
right into the blockhole outside off, dug out to point
dug out once again, superb yorker.
worked off his hip to deep midwicket
goes straight and connects! Into the commentary box, perhaps just below. Too full, got right underneath the flight and muscled it away
punched back, shorter in length. 'Yeh accha hai' (this is nice) yelps Pant
clears his front leg and clobbers this over long-off. What confidence, absolutely audacious. Back-to-back fifties for Pooran
cut away to deep cover, Rahul's the man there
fired full on the stumps, drilled to long-off
tried to hit it too hard, no timing, rolls off a thick inside edge to long-on
thick edge, Pant was going the wrong way, so had to change tracks, put his left glove out to half-stop. Just about carried to him, has to go down as a drop
pulled absolutely magically, but on the bounce to Rahul at deep midwicket
squeezes out the yorker-length delivery back to Shami
misses the yorker, dug out to wide long-on
deliberately done and this beats short third man. Opens the bat face slightly and carves this between keeper and the man at 45
drilled to long-off
excellent delivery, yorker towards the base of leg stump, dug out
clobbers this full toss straight to Rahul at sweeper cover
misses his length and bowls a full toss, mistimed back over the bowler's head, long-off comes around quick to cut that off
squeezes out this yorker to the off side
through for the pull before the ball arrived, hit on the back
solid hit down the ground to beat long-on! Right into his swinging arc, wrong length to bowl at this time of the innings
walks across the stumps to cover the line and wallop this short ball into the gap between deep midwicket and deep square! Superb.
beaten by the short ball he sprays across the left-hander, Pooran had to fetch it from a long way across

boy, oh boy! That is a remarkable hit. As if he's on the tennis court. Banged in short, he walked across to pull and both his feet were in the air when he slapped this away. Ensured he kept it all along the ground as well. Bisected deep midwicket and wide long-on
full toss, is it waist high? Not sure but he whips this and Rahul picks it late in the deep, and so it dies in front of him even as he dives full length forward
worked off his hip to deep square
short and he's dragged it from well over his right shoulder to the deep midwicket fence. Pure power
squeezes this yorker to mid-off
makes room and carves this yorker-length delivery to sweeper cover
full toss, got this too high on the bat as he tried to hit it over long-on
dug out to cover
<s>run out missed.</s> A direct hit from Kohli at the non-striker's end and Pooran may have been in trouble. He's visibly angry with himself
thick edge, Pant parries it over to the boundary. Had to put in a jump and go one-handed, he did but this didn't stick. Another tough chance goes down
slips this down leg, Pooran pulls and misses. Pant dives and grabs it down leg
sliced into the gap, no one at deep point. Astonishing batting. Shardul misses the yorker by an inch and sees the ball disappear
through his legs as he swings leg side. Beats Pant, who went the other way. Okay, umpire signals leg byes
flicked disdainfully over deep square. Touch of Yuvraj's swagger in that one! Pick up stroke to a full delivery into the pads. This is magnificent

he's slapped this straight to deep point and Pooran's magnificent knock is over. Jadeja picked it up early, ran in and was on the move as he completed a good catch. Shardul slowed it down, this was an offcutter on a length, got this to just hold up a little to deny Pooran pace on the ball. What a knock though, he will make many many hundreds, but will look back on this knock fondly if West Indies go on to win.
top-edges this pull and it flies over the keeper's head to the third man boundary. Lucky break
drags this full toss to find the gap between deep midwicket and long-on.
slapped, beats wide long-off. Iyer doesn't even bother trying to cover up ground because he knew there was no chance. Half-century for Pollard
dug out to deep cover
Kuldeep! Run out missed. driven straight to cover, a direct hit at the bowler's end from Kuldeep and Holder was gone, he didn't even make an attempt, was so far outside the crease.
walloped over deep midwicket. A full toss way outside off and he sent this soaring into the stands
swing and a miss, was a yorker-length delivery
dug out to cover, good yorker
goes straight and clears the sightscreen easily. At the moment, there's only 6 or nothing in Pollard's book. Give helmets to the fans, please. This is brutal hitting
another hit, what bottomhanded power! Low full toss, still had the power to hit that into the stands over the sightscreen. Magnificent. Absolutely magnificent
drilled to long-on
hit hard to long-on
drilled down the ground, good ground covered by Kohli to keep it to a single at long-off. 118 off the last 10 overs
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
full inswinger just outside off. Looks to jam the bat down on that and is beaten on the outside edge
full and curving in at the stumps. Driven back down the pitch
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
down leg side and he reaches out and flicks this this to the backward square leg boundary
length and just outside off. Angled-bat punch ends up in a thick inside edge into the leg side
length ball just shaping away in the corridor, solidly defended on the front foot
length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket's right off the back foot
length at leg stump. Defended off the back foot
length ball, angled in at off stump and moving away late. Watchfully defended into the off side
easy. Low full toss outside off. Just uses his wrists to whip this wide of mid-on
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
through the covers! Length ball pushed across the right hander. He steps out to reach the pitch of that and throws his hands at it. Off the toe part of the bat and through to the boundary
length at off stump, outside edge down to third man as he looks to defend
short of a length and just outside off. Allows that to come on and opens the face to get it to third man's right
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length ball slanted into the corridor. Left alone
launched over the midwicket boundary! Short of a length at leg stump. He walks down leg side to make room and nonchalantly pulls this well in front of square
length ball curving away outside off, left alone
poor bowling. Short and wide outside off. Sits up nicely and he steers this between point and cover off the back foot
short of a length outswinger outside off, left alone
short outside off, pushed back down the pitch
length ball swung in at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
length and just outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
full at the stumps, flicked to mid-on
cuts away. Length ball at off stump, he defends for the one coming in but this is past the outside edge
length on off, defended into the covers
falls short of the keeper. Another cutter it looks like. Length and in the corridor. Looks to defend and follows that with the hand. Hope can only gather the outside edge on the bounce
length ball shaping away outside off, follows with the hands and jabs it down to third man
length outside off, stabbed into the covers
length on leg stump, allows that on and uses the angle to nudge this past short fine
short of a length and cramped at middle stump. Hurriedly poked into the midwicket region
short of a length outside off, shifts the weight nicely onto back foot and opens the face to punch this past backward point
length at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
length at off stump, defended to point off the outside half
length and angled into middle. Glanced to fine leg with the slant
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
full on leg stump, driven neatly, wide of mid-on and all along the floor
not quite timed. Length and across the off stump. Gives it the charge and slices it over cover
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side from the crease
short of a length and angled across the corridor. Gets low and looks to ramp that towards third man. Beaten
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
short of a length just outside off, steered to third man off the back foot
length and down leg side. Uses the pace and tickles that fine
length and into the body. Looks to flick and cops that on the leg
length on leg stump, pushed to mid-on's right
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length at the stumps, nudged into the leg side with soft hands
short of a length just outside off and he does superbly to cut this to third man's right. Not that much room on that, but he has waited and got his bat in a great position to steer it
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length outside off, punched behind square on the rise
keeps low after landing on the leather. A cutter at length, headed towards middle stump. Just manages to defend that
length on off stump, punched down the ground
shot! Overpitched just outside off, gets his weight onto the front foot, leans in, gets the elbow high and punches sweetly to mid-off's left
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left. Alzarri sprints across to it but tumbles as he gets down to field it. Allows a second
short ball at off stump, sways into the leg side to let that go
length and just outside off, opens the face to run that to third man off the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
short of a length on leg stump, deflected to fine leg's right with the angle
beaten. Lobbed up at a length outside off. Looks to drive but doesn't get to the pitch of that. It slides past the edge
length on middle, flicked to midwicket's right
short and just outside off. Waits on that and cuts it aerially to short third man's right
length on leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
length on off stump, punched to long-off on the back foot
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
tossed up at leg stump, driven down to long-on
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length on leg stump, deflected to short fine off the pad as he looks to flick
full on off, driven to long-off
tossed up at a length on middle, flicked to long-on
length at middle, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
short of a length just outside off, looks to punch into the covers, gets an inside edge onto pad
length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
length on leg stump, dabbed to short fine's left
full and just outside leg stump. Gets down and places that sweep past backward square leg. Expertly done
length on off, tapped to extra cover's right
full on leg, leans in and drives to long-on
full on off stump, driven to sweeper's right
just gets bat on that. Arm ball. Headed for off stump and Rohit was initially shaping to defend for the one that turns away
length on middle, leans in and flicks with the angle to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
bouncer down leg side. That was rapid. He missed on the hook for pace
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
length on off stump, defended to point from the crease
swats it fine. Hurried on the hook again. Short and up at his shoulder. Quick hands, but still an awkward position. He wanted to hook that down quickly but it flew off the top edge
length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover to bring up 100 for the opening stand
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left and that's yet another white-ball fifty for KL Rahul in 2019. He has been in scintillating form in the second half of this year
length ball wide outside off, mistimed drive to sweeper cover
length and down leg side, looks to sweep and cops that on the pad
length at leg stump, flicked to short fine
length at middle, punched to extra cover
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
hops back into the crease and defends this short delivery
nice and full on the stumps, defended back
lovely flick but a good stop at mid-on, Rohit gets across for a single to bring up his 43rd ODI fifty
mistimes the pull to midwicket. Hurried onto him much faster than he expected
right behind the line as he gets on top of the bounce and defends
works this incoming length delivery into the leg side
works this to short midwicket, good stop
driven through the line, simply glorious. No chance for the diving extra cover fielder. Peerless
drifts in on a length, defended
punched down to long-on
eased gently to cover
steps out and drives to sweeper cover
length ball on middle and leg, worked wide of mid-on
bunts this down to square third man
angles in a length ball on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
beaten for pace as he attempts a pull, late on the shot so can only manage a thick bottom edge onto the body
pulled all along the ground to long leg
helps this along to fine leg
mistimes this slog sweep, but the boundary rider at deep midwicket - Ewin Lewis - was in two minds: do I attack the ball, do I save the boundary? The second's indecision costs them a wicket
steps out and works it to deep midwicket
drifts into middle and leg, worked to deep square leg
makes a hint of room and bunts it between cover and point
punches straight to cover again
swept into the gap at deep square, one bounce to the fence. Didn't control it as well as he would've liked as he hit it in the air, but there was no one there.
leading edge that rolls to mid-off, quick single taken

there's the edge and Rohit's gone, much to the relief of the West Indies. This was much-needed. Holder bowls a length ball, this one bounces touch more than Rohit expects, kisses the edge as the ball darts away and the edge is pouched nicely by Hope.
hint of width outside off, flayed to deep point to get off the mark
stands tall and punches to sweeper cover
works it off his hip to long leg
rises with the bounce as he defends from the crease
another misfield, another boundary! Makes room and caresses that through the hands of Hayden Walsh at extra cover
steps out and drills this to long-off with the spin
cuts to deep point
swept fiercely but he's missed out, hit straight to backward square leg
gentle tap into the gap at point for an easy single
drifting into middle and leg, wrists it to deep square leg
exquisite drive, straight to extra cover
leading edge but this falls safe, through covers for a single
slaps this short of length delivery between cover and point
it's once again that check drive that Kohli plays so very well. Just a gentle push off the frontfoot, not the full flow and it just speeds off the face of the bat.
driven firmly to sweeper cover
hops back and defends
runs it down to third man as he jogs a single
punched on the up to point
punches to point, can't pierce the gap again
plays his version of Kapil's Natraja shot as he pulls to deep square leg
sways out of the way of this short of length delivery outside off
nips back in to hit him on the thigh pad. Kohli was on the move as he played that
pulled to deep midwicket
punches this to mid-off, once again this just flies off the bat
shapes to pull, then decides maybe that's the wrong option and ends up steering it off balance to point region
stands tall and punches to point.
punches to mid-on as they scamper a quick single
gets in position quickly and pulls all along the ground to deep midwicket
bails out of the pull shot to this spongy bouncer
superb drive, but straight to cover. A cry of anguish
runs this down to third man as they jog through
looks to turn it through square leg from outside off, but gets an inside edge onto the pad. Ball rolls into the off side and they scamper through
slapped away to the cover boundary. Too short and it sat up nicely for Kohli to use width to put that away
runs this down to third man again
pulled all along the ground to deep square leg
plays the short-arm jab to short midwicket
flayed on the up to sweeper point
bunts this down to third man, you'd think he was cramped for room, but Kohli still managed to manufacture a single

that's a Rahul special! Length ball, angling into the pads and Rahul brings out a superb pick up shot that's all wrist and hand-eye coordination. Just a step across and brought out the twirl of his wrists to flick it disdainfully over deep square leg
punched but straight to point
drifts in full on the stumps, defended back. Kohli was looking to work it to the leg side
rocks back and slaps this into the gap at sweeper cover
punched straight to cover
thick edge, rolls to short third man
whips this down to long-on
works this down to long-on
hops back and defends this rising short ball
tapped wide of point as they scamper a quick single
not in control of this pull, no timing, down to deep square
short of length outside off, invitation there for the slash or upper cut, Rahul lets it go

he's gloved this to the keeper! This is pure pace from Alzarri, skids through the pitch to hurry Rahul into the attempted tuck off his hips, lobs to the leg side and Hope takes a dolly. He's missed a hundred for the taking, will be mighty disappointed but let's acknowledge a fine knock that could give the team management plenty of selection headaches when Dhawan gets fit again.
hops back and defends
whips this down to long-on
makes room and cuts to deep point to get off the mark
punched to cover, can't pierce the infield
lunges forward and turns this back to the bowler
squeezes the drive into the gap between cover and point, Hetmyer cuts it off in the deep
cut away to deep cover
whips this down to long leg
tucks this down to fine leg, they're attacking the body by going short from wide of the crease
imperious! This was premeditated, the moment he saw this short, the line of the delivery didn't matter. Bowled wide outside off, Kohli fetched it and managed to pick the bones out of it

terrific pull! This time goes onto the backfoot, quick transfer of weight back, right on top of the bounce as he brings out the cross court forehand. Superb wrist work to hit it in front of square, and that too all along the ground
runs it down to third man for an easy single
eased to third man for another single
attempted short ball but this doesn't rise as much as he expected, just about evades Iyer as he ducks
not sure what he was trying to do. Backed away and slashed at this to get a thick outside edge, third man runs over the ball

has he found the fielder? Yes, he has. Iyer has whipped this straight down the throat of fine leg. Alzarri is claiming the catch. Short ball angling into the body, Iyer hops across and tries to help it along. He's rushed into the stroke because of the pace on the delivery and Alzarri takes a good, low catch. So he can't get a fifth straight half-century in ODIs
length at off stump, pushed to point off the front foot
short of a length and just outside off, mistimed pull to midwicket
full on off stump, flicked fluently to find midwicket
length outside off, leans into the drive on the up and connects sweetly. Pollard can't stop cleanly with a dive to his right at extra cover
length and in at off stump, opens the face and runs it straight to point
length and just outside off, another nicely timed drive on the up. Pollard at mid-off this time, tumbling to his right to save
shot. Length and just outside off, shuffles to get in line and jabs it past the bowler with full balance and the full face of the bat offered
short of a length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
forces him to duck the bouncer. He shuffles into the off side and that forces him to get under this and let it go
deftly done. That's three scoring shots in three balls from Pant. This one is short of a length and up at his hips. Gets inside the line of that and tickles it fine
short of a length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
short of a length and wide outside off. Drives on the up with a flattish bat, can't beat extra cover
slower short ball at leg stump. Pulled along the floor to fine leg
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off

chopped on! Short and wide ball outside off, looks to punch through the off side but that appears to have stuck in the pitch. He was hitting quite a way away from the body though. Angled bat, inside edge and Keemo has wickets in back-to-back overs
length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
length in the corridor, defended into the covers
short of a length at off stump. Pushed into the leg side with soft hands
short outside off, hooked along the ground to deep square
length outside off, steered down to third man off the front foot

direct hit from the keeper at the striker's end. A risky single to the keeper's right...but Jadhav's just in. Short of a length ball in the corridor. Kohli looked to run that down to third man but couldn't get the pace on it. Jadhav called early, to his credit
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off who puts in an unnecessary throw that allows Kohli to get a second at deep square
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts straight to point
slower short ball down leg side. Pulls to fine leg and brings up his 55th ODI fifty
length at middle stump, flicked to fine leg with the angle
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover

short of a length just outside off, dropped in front of point. Wants to steal a run but Jadhav says no. And Kohli gives him an earful! Not the first time that's happened when these two have batted together
bat-pad as he gets forward to defend this length ball outside off stump
short of a length at off stump, shuffles and glances to fine leg
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
picks the gap. Full and down leg side again. Shuffles and flicks this to the left of fine leg and it sprints into the boundary padding
length on middle, shuffles and clips to fine leg
misfield! Oh that's poor from Holder. Short of a length outside off. Dabbed harmlessly down to third man where the former captain has made the ground and then let that through his legs
length on off stump, pushed to point from the crease
aaaand picks the gap again.Doesn't waste those loose balls in chases. Low full toss on the pads and he stays still and uses his wrists to bisect fine leg and deep square
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man
slower short ball at middle stump, shuffles and mistimes the pull. Gets it off the inside half and to fine leg

bowled him! Jadhav has played all around this one and that is a boisterous salute from Cottrell, timed in sync with the fireworks at the ground. This is an overpitched ball. His feet are rooted as he looks to drive and it comes back in off the surface to beat his inside edge and shatter the stumps
short ball up at the ribs. Shapes to pull, looks to withdraw, and in the meantime the ball hits glove and runs away fine
length outside off, punched on the rise to extra cover
short of a length outside off, run down to third man
short of a length outside off, opens the face and glides it to third man
short of a length at middle, shuffles and runs it to fine leg
short of a length on middle, clipped to deep square off the back foot
short outside off, stabbed down to third man
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
down leg and past the keeper. Overpitched and too much for both Jadeja and Shai Hope

nearly run out with a kick. Short of a length slower ball dropped pitch side on the off side. Cottrell v Kohli on the sprint. They're neck and neck until Cottrell unleashes a big right boot. Direct hit would have got Kohli
length outside off, pushed into the off side with soft hands
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
slower length ball outside off, pushed to third man off the thick outside edge
short of a length on middle, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
length in the corridor, opens the face and gets that down to third man
length outside off, shuffles and flicks to deep midwicket
length at middle stump, punched to long-on with the angle
short of a length at off, looks to run that down to third man but ends up poking that straight to point
length at off stump, shuffles and taps it to deep midwicket's right. Fielder does well to keep that to one after a big sprint in. Keemo Paul there
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, swiped to short fine from the crease
length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
superbly done. His last three boundaries have all been low-risk, touch boundaries. This is short outisde off. He allows it to come on and opens the face to run it past short third
length outside off, pushed to extra cover

whips it to the midwicket boundary! Pierre's natural trajectory and pace just feeds this Kohli favourite - length and fast and angled into him. He picks it up from outside off and sends it racing between long-on and deep midwicket
length outside off, dabbed in front of point with soft hands
length on leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's left
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
full at the stumps, flicked to deep square
length at middle stump, punched to midwicket's left. He slides to his right and fumbles, which allows a second
short in the corridor, ramped to third man on the bounce
length outside off, run down to third man with the angle
just past off stump. Kohli looks to drive a length ball away from the body and it cuts back past his inside edge
length outside off, leans in and flicks to long-on with the angle
length and angled into the stumps. Steps out and bunts this to mid-off
short at off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
oh well put away. Short and into the chest from around the wicket. No one out at deep midwicket. Jadeja gets on top of it and pulls it exactly there
full outside off, leans in and drives to mid-off
bouncer in the corridor, gets very steep. Too much for him to go through with the hook
lofted over extra cover! This has been very mature so far from Jadeja. Using the safe boundary options. This was an overpitched ball very wide outside off. Expands his arms and drills it
short outside off, pulled firmly to deep midwicket
slower length ball at off stump, shuffles and pushes into the midwicket region with soft hands
whew, some serious timing on these Jadeja pull shots. Short in the corridor and this is pummeled to deep square's right. Pooran does superbly to stop to his right
length outside off, shuffles, leans in front and uses the angle to clip this to deep midwicket

plays it on! Keemo Paul injecting life into this contest every time he comes on! It is an innocuous delivery though, not unlike the one that got Pant. Length and wide outside off. Drives away from the body and it pings off the inside edge. He missed one trying that against Holder not so long ago. This time he doesn't have that fortune. Kohli falls short of the finish line
hello! Thakur with an absolute world class drive through the covers. Stunning shot. Length outside off and he he whips out at it and gives no one a chance
short of a length and in at the body. Arches back and dabs it to third man
length on off stump, punched on the rise to long-off
short of a length outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
attempted legcutter rolls through to the keeper down leg side. Cottrell's bowled a few too many of those in his late spells
beaten on the inside edge. Length ball skids straight on as Jadeja swishes over it wide outside off
gets away with a short, slower ball at the hips. Short fine leg is in and Jadeja's pull is mistimed straight at him
bouncer at a middle stump line. Too quick for Thakur to connect on the hook. Also too high, that is called wide
over the long leg boundary! Short ball up at the ribs, swishes from underneath that and gets it off the top edge, sails right over the fielder running to his left
pumped to the midwicket boundary! Thakur is taking them on! Full ball on leg stump, and he stays deep in the crease and nonchalantly whips this to long-on's right
length and in at middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off. Spanked on the up to deep midwicket

run out appeal but surely Thakur has been let off by mid-off. Full ball on off, driven firmly to mid-off. Thakur takes off and is sent back from about halfway up the pitch, slipped on his backside and had no chance. Except....the fieler decides to lob it back to the bowler and it is high and not useful at all. Thakur comes back
calmly done. Slower bouncer down leg side. Allows that to come on and watches closely before nudging this fine
length outside off, leans in and punches to sweeper's left with some elegance. Got his weight nicely into that and picked up two to tie the scores
full on middle stump, drilled straight to mid-on and this time it's Thakur saying no to the run

run out appeal is sent upstairs but the TV umpire has said that Keemo Paul has overstepped. Thakur had made his ground anyway. It was a length ball pushed into the leg side and the underarm throw hit the striker's stumps
